      • getData

        public Object getData()
        Return the custom data object associated with this profile, which was set by the previous setData(Object) call. This association is valid for the duration of the process lifetime. The caller must ensure proper synchronization, typically by synchronizing on the object returned by getLock(). The data object is usually a database object that stores per-profile data such as page history. However, it can be any other object that needs to maintain profile-specific state.
        Returns:
        Associated data object

      • setData

        public void setData(Object data)
        Associate this profile with a custom data object, which can be retrieved by subsequent getData() calls. The caller must ensure proper synchronization, typically by synchronizing on the object returned by getLock().
        Parameters:
        data - Custom data object

      • getClientId

        @WorkerThread
public String getClientId()
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        Retrieves the Gecko client ID from the filesystem. If the client ID does not exist, we attempt to migrate and persist it from FHR and, if that fails, we attempt to create a new one ourselves. This method assumes the client ID is located in a file at a hard-coded path within the profile. The format of this file is a JSONObject which at the bottom level contains a String -> String mapping containing the client ID. WARNING: the platform provides a JSM to retrieve the client ID [1] and this would be a robust way to access it. However, we don't want to rely on Gecko running in order to get the client ID so instead we access the file this module accesses directly. However, it's possible the format of this file (and the access calls in the jsm) will change, leaving this code to fail. There are tests in TestGeckoProfile to verify the file format but be warned: THIS IS NOT FOOLPROOF. [1]: https://dxr.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/source/toolkit/modules/ClientID.jsm
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the client ID could not be retrieved.

      • generateNewClientId

        protected static String generateNewClientId()

      • isClientIdValid

        public static boolean isClientIdValid(String clientId)

      • getAndPersistProfileCreationDate

        @WorkerThread
public long getAndPersistProfileCreationDate(android.content.Context context)
        Gets the profile creation date and persists it if it had to be generated. To get this value, we first look in times.json. If that could not be accessed, we return the package's first install date. This is not a perfect solution because a user may have large gap between install time and first use. A more correct algorithm could be the one performed by the JS code in ProfileAge.jsm getOldestProfileTimestamp: walk the tree and return the oldest timestamp on the files within the profile. However, since times.json will only not exist for the small number of really old profiles, we're okay with the package install date compromise for simplicity.
        Returns:
        the profile creation date in the format returned by System.currentTimeMillis() or -1 if the value could not be persisted.

      • updateSessionFile

        public void updateSessionFile(boolean shouldRestore)
        Updates the state of the old session data file. sessionstore.js should hold the current session, and sessionstore.old should hold the previous session (where it is used to read the "tabs from last time"). If we're not restoring tabs automatically, sessionstore.js needs to be moved to sessionstore.old, so we can display the correct "tabs from last time". If we *are* restoring tabs, we need to delete outdated copies of sessionstore.old, so we don't continue showing stale "tabs from last time" indefinitely.
        Parameters:
        shouldRestore - Pass true if we are automatically restoring last session's tabs.

      • waitForOldSessionDataProcessing

        public void waitForOldSessionDataProcessing()

      • readSessionFile

        public String readSessionFile(boolean readBackup)
        Get the string from a session file. The session can either be read from sessionstore.js or sessionstore.bak. In general, sessionstore.js holds the current session, and sessionstore.bak holds a backup copy in case of interrupted writes.
        Parameters:
        readBackup - if true, the session is read from sessionstore.bak; otherwise, the session is read from sessionstore.js
        Returns:
        the session string

      • readPreviousSessionFile

        public String readPreviousSessionFile()
        Get the string from last session's session file. If we are not restoring tabs automatically, sessionstore.old will contain the previous session.
        Returns:
        the session string

      • sessionFileExists

        public boolean sessionFileExists()
        Checks whether the session store file exists.

      • ensureParentDirs

        @WorkerThread
protected boolean ensureParentDirs(String filename)
        Ensures the parent director(y|ies) of the given filename exist by making them if they don't already exist..
        Parameters:
        filename - The path to the file whose parents should be made directories
        Returns:
        true if the parent directory exists, false otherwise

      • getDefaultProfileName

        public static String getDefaultProfileName(android.content.Context context)
                                    throws GeckoProfileDirectories.NoMozillaDirectoryException
        Returns:
        the default profile name for this application, or DEFAULT_PROFILE if none could be found.
        Throws:
        GeckoProfileDirectories.NoMozillaDirectoryException - if the Mozilla directory did not exist and could not be created.

      • enqueueInitialization

        public void enqueueInitialization(java.io.File profileDir)
        This method is called once, immediately before creation of the profile directory completes. It queues up work to be done in the background to prepare the profile, such as adding default bookmarks. This is public for use *from tests only*!
